result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher G. Meyer

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Christopher G. Meyer
Current: 905 W. Madison Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 10-26-2022)
Prior: 4777 88th Avenue, c/o Kenosha County Detention Center, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States

8:16 AM Prosecuting attorney Drew Lehman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher G. Meyer in court.  Attorney Chad A Shamali in court for Christopher G. Meyer. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Motion to rescind unlawful conditions of bond filed by Attorney Shamali. Discussion held. Court amends signature bond conditions to:
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol. No drug paraphenalia. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Danae F-t, Alexis P.  or their residences. 
**DE is to remain in the State of Wisconsin during the pendency of this case.**
**DE must report in person to the Court every 2 weeks; Jury status hearing set for 11/9/22 at 1:30 pm; Jury selection on 11/14/22 at 8:30; If matter proceeds after 11/14/22 DE must appear every 2 weeks starting 11/28/22 every Monday at 8:15 am before the Court**
DE signs amended bond in court; Clerk provides copy of amended bond to DE. DE updates his address on the record.
Notice of Hearing sent to DE's last known address.
Motion hearing on October 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Motion to Rescind Unlawful Conditions of Bond filed by Attorney Shamali

**AMENDED**
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM. *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol. No drug paraphenalia. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Danae F-t, Alexis P.  or their residences. 
**DE is to remain in the State of Wisconsin during the pendency of this case.**
**DE must report in person to Attorney Shamali every 2 weeks; Attorney Shamali shall provide updates to the Court regarding  these meeting.**

1:41 PM State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Defendant Christopher G. Meyer in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad A Shamali in court for Christopher G. Meyer. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: State advises the Court that the drug results will not be ready in time for the DE's speedy trial demand and moves to amend the DE's bond to a signature bond. The State advises the Court that the drug results should be returned by the end of October. Motion to amend the information filed by the State; No objection by Attorney Shamali and reading of the amended information is waived. Based on the State's inability to meet the DE's speedy trial demand Court will amend bond to a $20,000 signature bond w/ the same conditions. Also added conditions of *DE to remain in the State of Wisconsin during the pendency of this case and * DE must report in person to Attorney Shamali every 2 weeks; Attorney Shamali shall provide updates to the Court regarding these meetings.
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury selection scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Amend Information
State's Amended List of Witnesses and Demand and Discovery

01:34 PM  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Christopher G. Meyer, appeared in custody with Attorney Chad A Shamali.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Motion for modification of bond filed by Attorney Shamali. Arguments heard. The State objects to the bond motion. The Court denies the bond motion for reasons set forth on the record. Court will remove the PTC scheduled for 10/6/22.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher G. Meyer appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  ST called witness KSD Dep Keith Kirwan; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Shamali. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling Order
Atty Shamali reschedules STC to a PH on 07-15-22 at 10am Intake  DA notified.
filed by Attorney Chad Shamali

from the court re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22 mailed to the DE

Defendant Christopher G. Meyer in court, in custody.  Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
DE is eligible for SPD Services however no attorney has agreed to represent this applicant

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.  
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  No drug paraphenalia  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Danae F-T., Alexis P. or their residences.

02:00 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson. Clerk: PU   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 10:45 am. Warrant vacated. $7500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). rb
